results.title: WHO: The kids are alright
results.creator_credit: BMG Music, Bill Curbishley, Tony Klinger and Jeff Stein
results.brief_description: Features live performances of the Who’s most celebrated hits from “My generation” to the sophistication of the rock opera “Tommy”. Along with the guitar-smashing exuberance of the group’s stage performances, director Jeff Stein has assembled a series of interviews which reflect the collective and individual nature of the band.

results.title: Who framed Roger Rabbit?
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Robert Watts, Frank Marshall and Robert Zemeckis
results.brief_description: A magical blend of live-acting and animation that comes off brilliantly due to the super effort by Bob Hoskins in playing to imaginary “co-stars” who were drawn in later. Hoskins plays Eddie Valiant, a has-been gumshoe in the ‘40s film noir mould who comes out of a self enforced retirement. Someone is out to steal Toon Town from the cartoon characters who inhabit the magical land. To get their hands on the valuable property they frame its biggest star, Roger Rabbit for murder. Detective Valiant must solve the case and save the toons. Cast also includes Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy, Stubby Kaye and Charles Fleisher. Based on the story “Who censored Roger Rabbit?” by Gary K. Wolf and winner of four Academy Awards.

results.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Ernest Lehman and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: Nichol’s debut feature after a string of successes on Broadway retained the taboo-breaking profane and sexually charged dialogue of Albee’s stage play, the likes of which had not previously been heard in a big studio film. Burton and Taylor play a married couple in decline who engage in a relentless, vitriolic war of words over the course of one night in the presence of their guests. The film was rehearsed for three weeks before shooting started and was both a critical and box-office success, winning five Oscars. Cast: Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Sandy Dennis, George Segal.

results.title: White zombie
results.creator_credit: Edward C. Halperin and Victor Halperin
results.brief_description: In this eerie, theatrically staged horror film, a young couple, Madeleine Short (Madge Bellamy) and Neil Parker (John Harron) encounter the world of voodoo and zombies in the Haitian mountains when they arrive as guests of Charles Beaumont (Robert Fraser). When their host enlists the evil powers of Muder Legende (Bela Lugosi) to place a curse on Madeleine, a series of chilling events occur.

results.title: White nights
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Delphi V Productions, New Visions Pictures, William S. Gilmore and Taylor Hackford
results.brief_description: This Cold War thriller stars real-life dancer Mikhail Baryshnikov as a Russian defector who finds himself trapped in his homeland when his plane crashes in Siberia. Billeted with an American dancer (Gregory Hines), Kolya is desperate to escape and hatches a daring plan but must evade the keen attentions of the KGB. Whilst the plot is fair to middling, the dancing in this feature film is brilliant, making the most of the two lead’s spectacular talents. Also stars Helen Mirren and Isabella Rossellini.

results.title: White hunter: black heart
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: One of Clint Eastwood’s most engaging films, “White hunter, black heart” is based on Peter Vietel’s novel about the location shoot of John Huston’s immortal “The African Queen”. The focus, however, is never on Bogie and Hepburn, but rather on the obsessive director who is determined to turn his new film project into a grand personal quest, hunting a wild elephant. Cast includes Clint Eastwood, Jeff Fahey, George Dzundza, Alun Armstrong and Marisa Berenson.

results.title: White heat
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Louis F. Edelman and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: The searing classic featuring the last great gangster performance by the legendary James Cagney. In 1931, Cagney stunned audiences with his portrayal of a no-good street punk in “Public Enemy” and helped define the screens’ image of underworld thugs. In “White Heat” he expands that image with a blistering performance as psychotic gangland kingpin Cody Jarrett. Devoted to his hard boiled Ma and possessed of an itchy trigger finger, Jarrett is a study of unequalled ferocity, a walking timebomb who robs, tortures and kills without conscience. When he is finally captured, Jarrett escapes a murder rap by doing time for a lesser crime. Still, “The Big House” cannot hold him and he escapes into one of the most famous finales of movie history. Driven by Raoul Walsh’s keen direction and Cagney’s vivid, hypnotic characterisation, “White Heat” won Life Magazine’s kudos as a wild and exciting picture of mayhem and madness.

results.title: White Christmas
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Robert Emmett Dolan and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: White Christmas is a treasury of Irving Berlin classics, among them “Count Your Blessings Instead of Sheep”, “Sisters”, “Blue Skies”, and the beloved holiday song “White Christmas”. Two talented song-and-dance men (Bing Crosby and Danny Kaye) team up after the war. One winter they join forces with a sister act (Rosemary Clooney and Vera-Ellen) and trek to Vermont for a white Christmas. The result is “the stuff dreams are made of”.

results.title: Whistle down the wind
results.creator_credit: Beaver Films, Richard Attenborough and Bryan Forbes
results.brief_description: Based on Mary Hayley Bell’s popular novel, this is a charming and thoughtful study of the fragile nature of childhood trusts and beliefs. Hayley Mills and Alan Bates give excellent performances in this story of three innocent children who find a fugitive from the law in their barn and believe that he is Jesus. Produced by award-winning Richard Attenborough, this film is a poignant unveiling of the children’s gradual understanding of the truth, which will delight adults and children alike.

results.title: While you were sleeping
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Joe Roth, Roger Birnbaum and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: Lucy (Sandra Bullock), a young subway ticket collector spends her days fantasising about one of her regular commuters, Peter (Peter Gallagher). One day fate intervenes when Lucy witnesses Peter being mugged at the station and tossed on to the tracks. Saving him from near death, Lucy gets Peter to hospital where through a misunderstanding his family assume that Lucy is Peter’s fiancee. However the plot takes a further turn when Lucy finds herself attracted to Peter’s brother Jack (Bill Pullman). A charming romantic screwball comedy. Cast also includes Peter Boyle, Glynis Johns, Micole Mercurio, Jack Warden.
